_meanings:
<ab>N.</ab> of a country in the extreme south of India,
and lying to the south-west of Choladeśa. The
mountain Malaya and the river Tāmraparṇī fix
its position indisputably; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>B. R. 3. 31.</ls> It may
be identified with the modern Tinnevelly. The
holy island of Rāmeśvara belonged to this 
kingdom, Kālidāsa calls the capital of Pāṇḍya-deśa
the ‘serpent-town’, which is probably the same as
Negapattan 160 miles south of Madras; <ab>cf.</ab>  
<ls>R. 6. 59-64</ls>.
